simplesect.title: RHEL6 support
simplesect.para: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 platform is now supported. For details, see .

simplesect.title: New osquery source
simplesect.para: The osquery application allows you to ask questions about your machine using an SQL-like language. For example, you can query running processes, logged in users, installed packages and syslog messages as well. You can make queries on demand, and also schedule them to run regularly.
The osquery() source of &abbrev; allows you read the results of periodical osquery queries and automatically parse the messages. For details, see .

simplesect.title: New HTTP destination
simplesect.para: The &abbrev; application can directly post log messages to web services using the HTTP protocol, without having to use Java.
HTTPS connection, as well as password- and certificate-based authentication is supported. For details, see .

simplesect.title: Look up GeoIP2 data from IP addresses
simplesect.para: The &abbrev; application can lookup IP addresses from an offline GeoIP2 database, and make the retrieved data available in name-value pairs. Depending on the database used, you can access country code, longitude, and latitude information, and many more in addition to what you could access with geoip(). For details, see .
You can use the geoip2 template function to format messages to contain GeoIP data. For details, see .

simplesect.title: The geoip() parser is deprecated.
simplesect.para: The geoip() parser is now deprecated. Use the geoip2 parser instead.
